description: dashboard: deprecation notice for the old dashboard

messages.text:
On 21 December 2011 21:40, David Symonds <dsymonds@golang.org> wrote:
> LGTM
>
> But if it "has moved" (past tense), why not just redirect?

The Windows build is still broken, meaning we can't build the
necessary version of gobuilder to run the new windows builders.

We still need this page. The associated pages (Package, Project) are
not out of date, either.

Andrew

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

LGTM

But if it "has moved" (past tense), why not just redirect?

LGTM

As long as there is a link, any text is fine with me.

On Wed, Dec 21, 2011 at 9:49 PM, Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> On 21 December 2011 21:40, David Symonds <dsymonds@golang.org> wrote:
>> LGTM
>>
>> But if it "has moved" (past tense), why not just redirect?
>
> The Windows build is still broken, meaning we can't build the
> necessary version of gobuilder to run the new windows builders.
>
> We still need this page. The associated pages (Package, Project) are
> not out of date, either.

Maybe it should say "is moving" then.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=447e3d106d55 ***

dashboard: deprecation notice for the old dashboard
